dialogues.text: Forrest and Mrs. Gump have their picure taken in front of large statue. A military recruiter spots Forrest and step up to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest, I'm so proud of you. Here,  I'll hold this for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Gump takes the diploma from Forrest. The recruiter s Forrest on the shoulder and hands him some military  literature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations, son. Have you given  any thought to your future?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest looks at a pamphlet with a photo of "Uncle Sam" a the caption "EXCELLENT CAREERS FOR EXCELLENT YOUNG MAN. A now at your local U.S. Army Recruiting Center."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, I'm Forrest...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest steps onto the army bus. Rain pours outside as th army bus driver yells at Forrest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Forrest Gump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody gives a hunk of shit who you  are, fuzzball! You're not even a  lowlife scum sucking maggot! Get  your faggoty ass on the bus. You're  in the Army now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest is about to sit on the first available seat, but recruit sitting there refuses Forrest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This seat's taken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest tries to sit on the next seat, but the 2nd recrui slides over, blocking him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's taken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest steps forward, looking much like he did on his fi bus ride to school years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At first, it seemed like I made a  mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large black recruit with a strange look on his face, mu like Forrest's, looks up from his seat. His name is BUBBA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...seeing how it was my induction  day and I was already gettin' yelled  at.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bubba moves his case over, making room for Forrest to sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can sit down... if you want to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know who I might meet or  what they might ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bubba hands Forrest a handkerchief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever been on a real shrimp boat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but I been on a real big boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm talkin' about a shrimp catchin'  boat. I've been workin' on shrimp  boats all my life. I started out my  uncle's boat, that's my mother's  brother, when I was about maybe nine. I was just lookin' into buyin' a  boat of my own and got drafted. My  given name is Benjamin Buford Blue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bubba and Forrest shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People call me Bubba. Just like one  of them redneck boys. Can you believe  that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name's Forrest Gump. People call  me Forrest Gump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Bubba was from Bayou La Batre,  Alabama, and his momma cooked shrimp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bubba's mother, a robust woman in a cook's uniform, carri a bowl of shrimp into a dining room. She sets it down on table in front of a wealthy white man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And her momma before her cooked  shrimp.

dialogues.speaker: SLAVERY
dialogues.text: Bubba's grandmother carries a bowl of shrimp into a dinin room. She sets it down on a table in front of a wealthy w man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And her momma before her momma cooked  shrimp, too. Bubba's family knew  everything...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...there was to know about the  shrimpin' business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know everything there is to know  about the shrimpin' business. Matter  of fact, I'm goin' into the shrimpin'  business for myself after I get out  the Army.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DRILL SERGEANT is in Forrest's face as Forrest stands i line with the other recruits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gump! What's your sole purpose in  this Army?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To do whatever you tell me, Drill  Sergeant!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Godamnit, Gump! You're a goddamned  genius! That's the most outstanding  answer I've ever heard. You must  have a godamned I.Q. of a hundred  and sixty! You are godamned gifted,  Private Gump!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Drill Sergeant moves down the line to the next man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen up, people...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, for some reason, I fit in the  Army like one of them round pegs. It's not really hard. You just make  your bed real neat and remember to  stand up straight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is one very intelligent  individual! You lock your scuzzy  bodies up behind that private and do  exactly what he does and you will go  far in this man's army!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And always answer every question  with "Yes, Drill Sergeant!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that clear? FORREST & RECRUITS Yes, Drill Sergeant!

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER DAY
dialogues.text: The recruits are sitting at the base of their bunks assem their rifles. Bubba speaks to Forrest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you do is you just drag your  nets across the bottom. On a good  day, you can catch over a hundred  pounds of shrimp. If everything goes  all right, two men shrimpin' ten  hours, less what you spends on gas,  you can...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest finishes assembling his rifle as the other recrui are still working on theirs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Done, Drill Sergeant!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gump!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Drill Sergeant rushes up to Forrest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you put that weapon together  so quickly, Gump?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told me to, Drill Sergeant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Drill Sergeant looks at his stop watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ! This is a new company  record. If it wouldn't be a waste of  such a damn fine enlisted man, I'd  recommended you for O.C.S., Private  Gump. You are gonna be a General  some day, Gump! Now, disassemble  your weapon and continue!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Drill Sergeant walks away as Forrest begins to disass his rifle. After the Drill Sergeant walks past Bubba, Bub looks up at Forrest. Bubba continues talking about shrimp his slow southern drawl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, like I was sayin', shrimp is  the fruit of the sea. You can barbecue  it, boil it, broil it, bake it, saute  it. There, uh, shrimp kabobs, shrimp  creole...

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER DAY
dialogues.text: Bubba and Forrest shine their boots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...shrimp gumbo, panfried, deep fried,  stir fried. There's pineapple shrimp,  lemon shrimp, coconut shrimp, pepper  shrimp...

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER DAY
dialogues.text: Bubba and Forrest are on their hands and knees as they sc the floor with toothbrushes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...shrimp soup, shrimp stew, shrimp  salad, shrimp and potatoes, shrimp  burger, shrimp sandwich... that's,  that's about it.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Bubba lies in his bunk and looks up quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nighttime in the Army is a lovely  time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest lies in his bunk and looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd lay there in our bunks, and I'd  miss my momma. And I'd miss Jenny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A young private tosses a Playboy magazine onto Forrest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Gump. Get a load of the tits on  her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest pick up the magazine and turns the page, revealin Jenny as she poses with a school sweater on, and that's a The pictorial is titled: "Girls of the South." Forrest lo up with shock. He cranes his head up for a closer look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turns out, Jenny had gotten into  some trouble over... some photos of  her in her college sweater. And she  was thrown out of school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "My baby does the hanky-panky..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest, in his army uniform, steps into the foyer of the club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that wasn't a bad thing. Because  a man who owns a theater in Memphis,  Tennessee, saw those photo and offered  Jenny a job singing in a show. The  first chance I got, I took the bus  up to Memphis to see her perform in  that show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EMCEE steps out onto the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was Amber, Amber Flame. Give  her a big hand, guys. Good job, Amber. And now, for your listening and  viewing pleasure, direct from  Hollywood, California, our very own  beatnik beauty, let's give a big  round of applause to the luscious  Bobbie Dylan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobbie... Bobbie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The emcee walks back off the stage and the curtain opens, revealing Jenny as she sits on a stool on the stage. She  holds a guitar up and begins to play. She is topless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sings) "Yes, and how many seas must the  white dove said, before she sleeps  in the sand."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her dream had come true. She was a  folk singer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sings) "Yes, how many times must the  cannonballs fly before they're forever  banned."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta lose the guitar, darling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, come on, baby. Shake it up. Shake it up now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, somebody ought to get her a  harmonica.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sings) "The answer, my friend is blowing in  the wind. The answer is blowing in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...skin, honey. This isn't Captain  Kangaroo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah! Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man #5 reaches up and tries to stick some money in Jenny' shoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, honey, I got something here for  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny kicks his hand. He yells angrily as he sits back do then tosses his drink on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamnit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Hey! Stupid jerk! I'm singing a  song here. Polly, get out here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, show us some stuff, honey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! Oh, shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest walks up to Man #5 and grabs him and tosses him d on the ground. Man #4 tries to grab Forrest, but Forrest  shoves him down too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest, what are you doing here?  What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest climbs up onto the stage and picks Jenny up, guit and all, and carries her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Forrest, let me  down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny struggles and frees herself from Forrest. Forrest s back in surprise. Jenny shoves the guitar at Forrest. Jen walks off as Forrest holds the guitar. He follows after h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest follows Jenny over a bridge outside the night clu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't keep doing this, Forrest. You can't keep tryin' to rescue me  all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They was tryin' to grab you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot of people try to grab me. Just -- you can't keep doing this all the  time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't help it. I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest, you don't know what love  is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny turns and looks over the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember that time we prayed,  Forrest? We prayed for God to turn  me into a bird so I could fly far,  far away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I can fly off this bridge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, Jenny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny turns and looks at the light of an approaching vehi She steps into the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta get outta here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny runs and flags down the approaching vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But wait. Jenny!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest, you stay away from me, okay? You just stay away from me, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pickup truck pulls over as Jenny looks at the driver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I have a ride?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So bye-bye, Jenny. They sendin' me  to Vietnam. It's this whole other  country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny walks toward Forrest. She looks at the driver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just hang on a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny walks up to Forrest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, you promise me something,  okay? Just if you're ever in trouble,  don't try to be brave, you just run,  okay? Just run away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Jenny, I'll write you all the  time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny takes a last look at Forrest, then climbs into the  truck. Forrest watches Jenny in the pickup as it drives a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And just like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest, dressed in his uniform, sits on a log and looks at a river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...she was gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Gump walks toward Forrest and sits down next to him the log. Forrest leans down, placing his head on his moth shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You come back safe to me, do ya hear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shadow of a helicopter over the rice field below. A  soldier is manning a gun from inside the helicopter. The  solider looks left, Forrest and Bubba ride in the helicop

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter circles overhead, then lands at the fireba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Some folks are born made to wave  the flag. Ooh, they're red, white  and blue. And when the band plays  "Hail to the Chief," ohh, they point  the cannon at you all. It ain't me. It ain't me. I ain't no Senator's  son, no. It ain't me. It ain't me..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bubba and Forrest jump out of the helicopter with their g They walk and look around oddly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, they told us that Vietnam was  gonna be very different from the  United Sates of America.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldier places a case of beer on a large stack of cas He takes two beers out and walks away. In the background, soldiers are barbecuing steaks and drinking beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except for all the beer cans and the  barbecue, it was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'know, I bet there's shrimp all in  these waters. They tell me these  Vietnams is good shrimp. You know,  after we win this war, and we take  over everything we can get American  shrimpers to come on here and shrimp  these waters. We'll just shrimp all  the time, man. So much shrimp, why,  you wouldn't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant DAN TAYLOR steps out of a tent. Shirtless, he  holds a roll of toilet paper in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must be my F.N.G.'s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning', sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ho! Get your hands down. Do not salute  me. There are goddamned snipers all  around this area who would love to  grease an officer. I'm Lieutenant  Dan Taylor. Welcome to Fourth Platoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lt. Dan looks at Bubba.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with your lips?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was born with big gums, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, you better tuck that in. Gonna get that caught on a trip wire.  Where you boys from in the world? BUBBA & FORREST Alabama, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You twins?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest and Bubba look at each other oddly, they don't ge the joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we are not relations, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, it's pretty basic here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lt. Dan starts to walk. Bubba and Forrest grab their gear and follow him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stick with me, you learn from  the guys who been in country awhile,  you'll be right. There is one item  of G.I. gear that can be the  difference between a live grunt and  a dead grunt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lt. Dan stops and looks at the boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Socks, cushion, sole, O.D. green.  Try and keep your feet dry when we're  out humpin'. I want you boys to  remember to change your socks wherever  we stop. The Mekong will eat a grunt's  feet right off his legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lt. Dan steps over to a large black soldier named SERGEAN SIMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sergeant Sims! Goddamnit, where is  that sling-rope I told you to order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I put in requisitions at Battalion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, yeah, well you call those  sonabitches again, call them again  and again and again. I don't care  how much it takes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lt. Dan sure knew his stuff. I felt  real lucky he was my lieutenant. He  was from a long, great military  tradition. Somebody in his family  had fought and died in every single  American war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A distant relative of Lt. Dan's, wearing a revolutionary uniform, falls dead in the snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another relative, wearing a civil war uniform and bearing striking resemblance to Lt. Dan, falls down dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another relative, wearing a World War II, falls down dead the beach at Normandy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamnit, kick some ass!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on it, Lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get on it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lt. Dan steps back up to Bubba and Forrest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess you could say he had a lot  to live up to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lt. Dan walks along the walkway and Bubba and Forrest fol

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you boys are from Arkansas, huh? Well, I've been through there. Little  Rock's a fine town. Now, go shake  down your gear, see the platoon  sergeant, draw what you need for the  field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lt. Dan steps inside the latrine, still holding the roll toilet paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you boys are hungry, we got steaks  burnin' right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lt. Dan sits down out of sight in the latrine, then stand up, looking at the boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two standing orders in this platoon. One, take good care of your feet.  Two, try not to do anything stupid,  like gettin' yourself killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lt. Dan sits back down out of sight in the latrine. Bubba and Forrest look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sure hope I don't let him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest, Bubba, and other soldiers in the Fourth Platoon  walk across the rice field. Some Vietnamese rice farmers working as the soldiers walk past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got to see a lot of countryside.  We would take these real long walks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest's unit walks along a dirt road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we were always lookin' for this  guy named Charlie. I can't get no  relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Lt. Dan holds up his fist, a signal for the unit stop. He motions for them to get down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold up, boys!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest gets down and looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't always fun. Lt. Dan always  gettin' these funny feelings about a  rock or a trail, or the road, so  he'd tell you to get down, shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get down! Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lt. Dan motions for the lead soldier to get down. Lt. Dan crouches down. Lt. Dan looks at the soldiers and points t his eyes. He lies down on the dirt road and crawls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, I don't know much about anything,  but I think some of American's best  young men served in this war. There  was Dallas, from Phoenix. Cleveland,  he was from Detroit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Tex. Hey, Tex. Man, what the  hell's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tex holds up his hand, motioning that he doesn't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Tex was, well, I don't remember  where Tex come from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, nothin'. Fourth Platoon, on your  feet! Still got ten clicks to go to  that river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest stands up and begins to walk with the platoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, move out! Comin' out. Look alive out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The good thing about Vietnam is there  was always someplace to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire in the hole!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lt. Dan walks away as Forrest rushes over, aims two pisto in the hole, then climbs inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there was always something to  do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mount 'em up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spread out! Cover his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANOTHER DAY - The platoon walks through a rice paddy, wai deep in water. It begins to rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One day it started raining, and it  didn't quit for four months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rain pours down on Forrest and Bubba as they sit in a foxhole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We been through every kind of rain  there is. Little bitty stingin'  rain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANOTHER DAY - The platoon walks through the jungle as rai pours down on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and big ol' fat rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANOTHER DAY - The platoon shelters themselves as they wal through the wind and rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rain that flew in sideways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANOTHER DAY - Forrest and other soldiers walk chest-deep  through a river. The rain splatters back up from the rive hitting the soldiers. Forrest holds his hand up to protec his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And sometimes rain even seemed to  come straight up from underneath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rain pours down on the men of the platoon as they sit a camp. Bubba sits down next to Forrest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoot, it even rained at night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bubba leans his back up against Forrest's back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Forrest...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Bubba...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna lean up against you, you  just lean right back against me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way, we don't have to sleep  with our heads in the mud. You know  why we a good partnership, Forrest? 'Cause we be watchin' out for one  another. Like brothers and stuff.  Hey, Forrest, there's somethin' I've  been thinkin' about. I got a very  important question to ask you. How  would you like to go into the  shrimpin' business with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, I tell you what, I got it all  figured out, too. So many pounds of  shrimp to pay off the boat, so many  pounds for gas, we can just live  right on the boat. We ain't got to  pay no rent. I'll be the captain; we  can just work it together. Split  everything right down the middle. Man, I'm tellin' you, fifty-fifty.  And, hey, Forrest, all the shrimp  you can get.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a fine idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bubba did have a fine idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANOTHER NIGHT - Some soldiers patrol the area. Forrest li in a pup tent and writes a litter as the rain pours down. uses his flashlight to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I even wrote Jenny and told her all  about it. I sent her letters. Not  every day, but almost. I told her  what I was doin' and asked her what  she was doing, and I told her how I  thought about her always.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny steps out of the trailer with a backpack and a guit She hugs a hippie guy, then jumps into the back of a  Volkswagen bus with another guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how I was looking forward to  getting a letter from her just as  soon as she had the time I'd always  let her know that I was okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest writes a letter in his tent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I'd sign each letter, "Love,  Forrest Gump."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Fourth Platoon makes their way through the jungle and rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "There's something happenin' here. What it is ain't exactly clear.  There's a man with a gun over there,  telling' me I got to beware."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one day, we was out walking,  like always, and then, just like  that, somebody turned off the rain  and the sun come out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest looks up as the sun suddenly appears. Forrest's  platoon is attacked. A bullet kills the soldier standing  next to Forrest. Bombs explode all around as the soldiers scramble to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take cover!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest crawls over a berm as bullets fly overhead and ex all around him. Forrest rolls over and pulls his pack off Lt. Dan lies next to Forrest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get that pig up here, goddammit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest, you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two soldiers with a machine gun fire into the jungle. Lt. Dan shouts into the radio. Forrest begins firing his weap into the jungle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Strongarm, please be advised...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two soldiers pull a wounded soldier into the jungle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Medic, we got a man down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strongarm, this is Leg Lima 6, over!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger, Strongarm, be advised we have  incoming from the treeline at point  blue plus two. A.K's and rockets...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The machine gunner fires into the treeline. Another soldi helps him with the ammunition. The machine gun jams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Misfire! Misfire!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddammit, Mac! Get that pig unfucked  and get it in the treeline!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rocket explodes on the machine gunner and the other sol killing them. Forrest looks down and covers his head as  rockets explodes all around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio) Ah, Jesus! My unit is down hard and  hurting! 6 pulling back to the blue  line, Leg Lima 6 out! Pull back! Pull back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest! Run! Run, Forrest!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest! Run! Run, Forrest! Run! Run!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull back! Let's go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lt. Dan gets up and grabs Forrest by the collar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run, goddammit, run!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The platoon gets up and runs toward the cover of the jung Rockets explode all around the field. Forrest runs into t jungle. The soldiers run through the jungle as bullets ex all around. A soldier is blown up by a rocket. A soldier  runs through the jungle. Forrest runs past the soldier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Medic! Medic! Jesus, can I get a  medic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ran and ran, just like Jenny told  me to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rockets explode in the jungle as Forrest runs out toward clearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ran so far and so fast that pretty  soon I was all by myself, which was  a bad thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bubba!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest turns around, then runs back into the jungle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bubba was my best good friend. I had  to make sure he was okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rockets explode in the jungle. Forrest runs back into the jungle to look for Bubba.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any friendlies out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I've got three over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest stops and aims his weapon. He looks around, scare

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bubba?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something moves. Forrest turns and looks, then rushes ove

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And on my way back to find Bubba,  well, there was this boy laying on  the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tex!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tex lies on the ground, his face distorted with pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest reaches down and picks up Tex from the ground. Fo pulls Tex up over his shoulder, then runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't just let him lay there  all alone, scared the way he was, so  I grabbed him up and run him out of  there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest carries Tex out of the jungle and into the cleari He sets Tex down on the bank of a river, and runs back in the jungle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And every time I went back looking  for Bubba, somebody else was saying,  "Help me, Forrest. Help me."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest drops another wounded soldier down at the bank of the river next to Tex, and then runs back toward the jung Forrest grabs the third wounded soldier up from the groun and turns him over. It is DALLAS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't hear... Can't hear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dallas is dropped off at the bank next to the other wound soldiers. Forrest turns to go back to the jungle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sweat, man. Just lay back. You're  gonna be okay. You're gonna be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I started to get scared that I might  never find Bubba.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over radio) You're danger close for crack air,  over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest trips over something and falls to the ground. He  looks up to find two bloody legs. It is Lt. Dan, who is  wounded. He speaks into the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio) Roger, Strongarm, I know my position  is danger close! We got Charlie all  over this area! I gotta have those  fast movers in here now! Over!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over radio) Six, Strongarm, we want...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant Dan, Coleman's dead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know he's dead! My whole goddamned  platoon is wiped out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over radio) Leg Lima 6, Leg Lima 6, how copy you  this transmission? Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest tries to pick up Lt. Dan, who tries to push Forre away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddammit! What are you doing? Leave  me here! Get away. Just leave me  here! Get out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest pulls Lt. Dan over his shoulder and runs through jungle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leg Lima 6, Leg Lima 6. This is  Strongarm, be advised, your fast  movers are inbound at this time,  over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then it felt like something just  jumped up and bit me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest falls down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, something bit me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest gets up as Lt. Dan yells. Lt. Dan fires his pisto at the unseen enemy as Forrest pulls him away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You dink son-of-a-bitch! I can't  leave the platoon! I told you to  leave me there, Gump. Forget about  me. Get yourself out! Did you hear  what I said! Goddammit, pull me down! Get your ass out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest drops Lt. Dan down at the bank, next to the other wounded soldiers. Lt. Dan grabs Forrest by the shirt, ang

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't ask you to pull me out of  there, goddamn you! What the hell do  you think you're going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To get Bubba.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got an air strike inbound right  now. They're gonna nape the whole  area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest gets up and runs as Lt. Dan yells after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gump, you stay here, goddammit! That's  an order!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta find Bubba!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest runs through the jungle searching for Bubba. Forr slows down and looks around carefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bubba...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bubba looks up as he lies on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bubba holds a palm frond over his wound. Forrest removes frond to look at the wound. Bubba's chest has been blown  open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Bubba, no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw, I'm gonna be all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest looks around as he hear the voices of the enemy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Come on. Come here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest carries Bubba through the jungle. The sound of  approaching planes fills the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay, Forrest. I'm all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The roar of approaching planes is deafening. Forrest look up in fear. Three planes dive down toward the jungle. The fire napalm as the jungle explodes with massive fireballs Forrest runs, carrying Bubba. The fireballs explode behin him. The entire jungle area is in flames as Forrest runs. Forrest carries Bubba to the bank of the river. Lt. Dan a the other wounded soldiers wait for a rescue helicopter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helo's inbound. Pop smoke, get it up  there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I'd a known this was gonna be the  last time me and Bubba was gonna  talk, I'd a thought of something  better to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest looks down at Bubba. A soldier releases a smoke  canister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Bubba...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Forrest. Forrest, why'd this  happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Bubba said something I won't  even forget.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bubba was my best good friend. And  even I know that ain't something you  can find just around the corner. Bubba was gonna be a shrimpin' boat  captain, but instead he died right  there by that river in Vietnam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter fly overhead.

dialogues.speaker: BUS STATION
dialogues.text: Forrest continues with his life story. A MAN is sitting n to Forrest on the bus bench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all I have to say about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a bullet, wasn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bullet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That jumped up and bit you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yes sir. Bit me directly in the  buttocks. They said it was a million  dollar wound, but the Army must keep  that money, 'cause I still ain't  seen a nickel of that million dollars. The only good thing about being  wounded in the buttocks...

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Forrest holds two ice cream cones in his hands as he is  wheeled on a rolling stretcher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...is the ice cream. They gave me  all the ice cream I could eat. And  guess what. A good friend of mine  was in the bed right next door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest, lying on his stomach, is wheeled to his bed. Forrest's butt sticks up and is bandaged. Forrest looks a Lt. Dan lying on the bed. Forrest holds out an ice cream  cone for Lt. Dan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant Dan, I got you some ice  cream. Lieutenant Dan, ice cream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lt. Dan, annoyed, takes the ice cream cone and drops it i his bed pan. Forrest slides himself onto his bed. A NURSE reaches toward Lt. Dan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's time for your bath, Lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The male nurse places Lt. Dan's hands on a pull-up bar, t picks up Lt. Dan, whose legs have been amputated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harper...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another nurse wheels the rolling bed under Lt. Dan. The m nurse sets Lt. Dan down on the rolling bed. Forrest looks at Lt. Dan as he is wheeled away. A soldier reads the nam from a pile of letters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper, Larson, Webster, Gump, Gump...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Forrest Gump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldier hands Forrest a large pile of letters. "Undeliverable as addressed. No forwarding order on file. Jenny Curran Rural Route 2 Greenbow, Ala. 39902 Forrest l down at the pile of letters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of wounded soldiers hang out in the hospital,  recuperating. Forrest sits and watches "Gomer Pyle" on th television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gump, how can you watch that stupid  shit? Turn it off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the D.M.Z. to the Delta, you  are tuned to the American Forces  Vietnam Network. This is Channel 6,  Saigon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest turns the TV off and he is hit on the back of the head by a ping-pong ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good catch, Gump. You know how to  play this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, let me show you. Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wounded ping-pong player hands Forrest a paddle. Forr and the wounded ping-pong player step toward the ping-pon table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now the secret to this game is, no  matter what happens, never, never  take your eye off the ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds the ball up and moves it back and forth. Forrest keeps his eyes on the ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wounded ping-pong player tosses the ball down onto th table. Forrest begins to hit the ball back to the other  player.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For some reason, ping pong came very  natural to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, any idiot can play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I started playing it all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest hits ping-pong balls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I played ping-pong even when I didn't  have anyone to play ping-pong with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The balls at land in a bed pan positioned on a chair. A g of wounded soldier sit and watch Forrest play with himsel Forrest hits two balls at a time against the opposite sid of the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hospital's people said it made  me look like a duck in water, whatever  that means. Even Lieutenant Dan would  come and watch me play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lt. Dan stares out the window. Forrest lies in his bed as A hand reaches and grabs him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I played ping-pong so much, I even  played it in my sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lt. Dan pulls Forrest to the floor, and holds Forrest dow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, you listen to me. We all have a  destiny. Nothing just happens, it's  all part of a plan. I should have  died out there with my men! But now,  I'm nothing but a goddamned cripple!  A legless freak. Look! Look! Look at  me! Do you see that? Do you know  what it's like not to be able to use  your legs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... Yes, sir, I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear what I said? You cheated  me. I had a destiny. I was supposed  to die in the field! With honor!  That was my destiny! And you cheated  me out of it! You understand what  I'm saying, Gump? This wasn't supposed  to happen. Not to me. I had a destiny.  I was Lieutenant Dan Tyler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo-You're still Lieutenant Dan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lt. Dan looks at Forrest, lets go of Forrest and rolls. Lt. Dan sits up as Forrest looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at me. What am I gonna do now? What am I gonna do now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest plays ping-pong by himself. An OFFICER walks up t him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: P.F.C. Gump?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest immediately grabs the ball and places it down on table under its paddle. Stands at attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The officer holds up an envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son, you've been awarded the Medal  of Honor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest steps up to Lt. Dan's bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess what, Lieutenant Dan, they  want to give me a me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest stops in mid-sentence as he looks down at the bed heavily bandaged soldier with bloodstains lies there. For turns and look at the NURSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma'am, what'd they do with Lieutenant  Dan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sent him home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two weeks later, I left Vietnam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on T.V.) The ceremony was kicked off with a  candid speech by the President  regarding the need for further  escalation of the war in Vietnam.  President Johnson awarded four Medals  of Honor to men from each of the  Armed Services.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The television reveals Forrest as he is awarded the Medal Honor by President Johnson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: America owes you a debt of gratitude,  son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Color footage revealing President Johnson as he places th award around Forrest's neck and shakes hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand you were wounded. Where  were you hit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the buttocks, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that must be a sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: President Johnson leans and whispers into Forrest's ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd kinda like to see that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The television revealing Forrest as he drops his pants, b over and shows the bullet wound on his bare buttocks. President Johnson looks down and smiles. The three men in the barber shop look up in disbelief. Mrs. Gump looks up shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn, son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest walks by the Lincoln Memorial. A fence surrounds Memorial, as well as armed military guards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After that, Momma went to the hotel  to lay down, so I went out for a  walk to see our national capital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hilary, all right, I've got the vets,  what do you want me to do with them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here so late?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest takes a photo of the memorial as a woman named Hi gathers together some veterans against the Vietnam War.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been waiting for you for half  an hour, so just get them in a line,  will you. Hey, hey, come on, pictures  later. You look great. Oh come on,  get in this line, come on, come on  right in line. Come on, let him here,  let him in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hilary grabs Forrest and puts him in the line with the ot vets against the war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a good thing Momma was resting,  'cause the street was awful crowded  with people looking at all the statues  and monuments. And some of them people  were loud and pushy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hilary leads the line of vets toward the large anti-Vietn War rally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, follow me! Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group of vets walk as Forrest tries to take another  picture. A vet behind him pushes him along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's move it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, buddy, come on. We could use  your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest walks in the line. A banner reads "Veterans again the War in Vietnam."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everywhere I went, I had to stand in  line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow me, let's go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hilary leads the vets through a crowd of people outside t rally. Another woman, named Isabel, leads the vets toward the back of a stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, come on, guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stand here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you're a good man for doin'  this. Good!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man, wearing an American flag shirt, stands on the stag He is anti-war activist ABBIE HOFFMAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We must declare to that fucking  impostor in the White House --  Johnson. We ain't going to work on  your farm no more! Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was this man, giving a little  talk. And for some reason, he was  wearing an American flag for a  shirt...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, I'm going to bring up some  soldiers that are going to talk about  the war, man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and he liked to say the "F" word. A lot. "F" this and "F" that. And  every time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...that war has come home, and we  have to stop these politicians...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...he said "F" word, people, for  some reason, well, they'd cheer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...these guys just told Lyndon Johnson  where to stick this fucking war!  Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest looks up at the cheering crowd. Abbie turns and  motions for Forrest to come up on the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, man. Come up here, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Come on. Yeah, you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hilary pulls Forrest up onto the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, get up there. Come on. Move,  move. Let's go! Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other vets follow Forrest pushes onto the stage and p him toward the microphones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, go. You can do it. Just get  up there. Go on. That's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thousands of cheering protesters stand around the Washing Monument. Forrest looks at the crowd. Abbie Hoffmann step up to Forrest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell us a little bit about the war,  man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The war in Vietnam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The war in Viet-fucking-nam!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abbie raises his fist as the crowd cheers wildly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was only one thing I could say  about the war in Vietnam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...there was only one thing I could  say about the war in Vietnam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest looks at the crowd as he speaks. A policeman look around as he sneaks over to the audio circuit board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Vietnam war...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The policeman pulls the patch cords out of the audio boar Forrest's amplified voice becomes inaudible. Forrest cont to speak into the microphone, even though no one can hear what he is saying. Hilary looks over and notices the  policeman. Hilary rushes over toward the audio board, pus the policeman away and grabs his night stick. Another  protester grabs the policeman and pulls him away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what the hell are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll beat your head in, you goddamned  oinker!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel, Hilary and another protester try to plug the tang mess of wires back into the audio board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, what'd they do with this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest continues to speak into the microphone. The crowd grows restless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't hear you! We can't hear  anything!

dialogues.text: Okay, but...

Yes,  we are against any war where black  soldiers are sent to the front line  to die for a country that hates them. Yes, we are against any war where  black soldiers go to fight and come  to be brutalized and killed in their  own communities as they sleep in  their beds at night. Yes, we are  against all these racists and imperial  dog acts.

Forrest smiles as Jenny looks at her Jenny climbs up into the bus. Wesley glares at Forrest. Forrest gives Wesley the "evil eye." Jenny through the ne window of the bus, knocks on the window. Forrest turns an looks. Jenny waves to Forrest. Forrest looks up and smile sadly. Jenny gives Forrest the peace sign as the bus pull away. The sign on the back of the bus reads "Berkeley to  D.C." Forrest gives Jenny the peace sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's one small step for man, one  giant leap for mankind. The, uh, the  surface is fine and powdery. I can,  I can pick it up loosely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I was going back to Vietnam,  but instead, they decided the best  way for me to fight communists was  to play ping-pong. So I was in the  Special Services, traveling around  the country cheering up all them  wounded veterans and showing them  how to play...

dialogues.text: Forrest looks at a man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

We  were the first Americans to visit  the land of China in like a million  years or something like that, and  somebody said that world peace was  in our hands. But all I did was play  ping-pong. When I got home...

dialogues.text: ...a few months later they invited  me and the ping-pong team to visit  the White House. So I went again. And I met the President of the United  States again.

dialogues.text: Oh, no, no, no, no. I know of a much  nicer hotel. It's brand-new. Very  modern. I'll have my people take  care of it for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
