dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sir, you might want to send a  maintenance man over to that office  across the way. The lights are off,  and they must be looking for the  fuse box or something, 'cause them  flashlights they're, they're keeping  me awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, sir. I'll check it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest hangs up the phone. The camera tilts down, reveal the hotel stationary, which reads "The Watergate Hotel."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: President Nixon makes a resignation speech on TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over television) Therefore, I shall resign the  Presidency effective at noon tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The television cuts to a shot of President Nixon standing outside Air Force One with his hands in the peace sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over television) Vice President Ford will be sworn in  as President at that hour in this  office. As I recall the high hopes  for America with which we began this  second term, I feel a great sadness  that I will not be here in this  office...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest is playing ping-pong by himself at the gymnasium. officer steps up to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sergeant Gump!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you were. I have your discharge  papers. Your service is up, son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The officer hands Forrest an envelope, then walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does this mean I can't play ping  pong no more?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the Army it does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And just like that, my service in  the United States Army was over. So  I went home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest takes his paddle and runs out of the gymnasium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Gump walks out of the house and smiles. Forrest walk up to the house, wearing his uniform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm home, Momma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Gump and Forrest walk into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise, he's here. He's here,  everybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, when I got home, I had no idea  that Momma had had all sorts of  visitors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the house are stacks of ping-pong paddles and life-siz cardboard cutouts of Forrest playing ping-pong. The name the ping-pong paddles boxes reads: "Gump-Mao table tennis

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've had all sorts of visitors,  Forrest. Everybody wants you to use  their ping-pong stuff. One man even  left a check for twenty-five thousand  dollars if you'd be agreeable to  saying you like using their paddle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Momma. I only like using my own  paddle. Hi, Miss Louise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Forrest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that. I know that. But it's  twenty-five thousand dollars, Forrest. I thought maybe you could hold it  for a while, see if it grows on you.  Oh, you look good, Forrest. You look  real good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That Momma, she sure was right. It's  funny how things work out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest walks up to a shack on the edge of the Bayou. A g of black kids play in the front yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't stay home for long, because  I'd made a promise to Bubba. And I  always try to keep my promise. So I  went on down to Bayou La Batre to  meet Bubba's family and make their  introduction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bubba's mother named MRS. BLUE and her other children loo at Forrest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you crazy, or just plain stupid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stupid is as stupid does, Mrs. Blue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest steps over to Bubba's tombstone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And of course, I paid my respect to  Bubba himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Bubba, it's me, Forrest Gump. I  remember everything you said, and I  got it all figured out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest pulls out notes from his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm taking the twenty-four thousand,  five hundred and six-two dollars and  forty-seven cents that I got...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest walks across a yard where men are cleaning shrimp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...well, that's left after a new  hair cut and a new suit and I took  Momma out to real fancy dinner and I  bought a bus ticket and three Doctor  Peppers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest walks along a wooden pier. Forrest pays an old bl shrimper a large wad of cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me something. Are you stupid or  something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stupid is as stupid does, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest stands at the grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's what's left after me  saying, "When I was in China on the  All-America Ping-Pong Team, I just loved playing ping-pong with my Flex- O-Ping-Pong Paddle." Which everybody  knows it isn't true, but Momma says  it's just a little white lie so it  wouldn't hurt nobody. So, anyway,  I'm putting all that on gas, ropes  and new nets and a brand-new shrimpin'  boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest steers his shrimping boat. The boat is old and ru Forrest unleashes his nets as his catch of the day drops the deck. It is a bunch of garbage and shells. Forrest pi up one shrimp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, Bubba had told me everything he  knows about shrimpin', but you know  what I found out? Shrimpin' is tough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest pulls a couple of shrimp out of a bucket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I only caught five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple of more, you can have  yourself a cocktail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old shrimper begins to walk away, then stops and look at Forrest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you ever think about namin'  this old boat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd never named a boat before, but  there was only one I could think of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest paints a name on the side of his boat. The name i "Jenny."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The most beautiful name in the wide  world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Disco lights flash and people dance. A guy asks a girl to dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny sits at a table with some other people. She is snor cocaine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, I hadn't heard from Jenny in a  long while. But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest stands at the helm as the boat glides across the  water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I thought about her a lot. And I  hoped that whatever she was doing  made her happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drug paraphernalia and a large wad of cash are spread out a table. A man drops a syringe on the table. He reaches o and touches Jenny. She is pale with dark lines under her  eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny smears some lines of cocaine on a mirror. She looks herself in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny steps out onto the high-rise balcony. She steps up a table and stands on the edge of the balcony. A busy str lies many stories below. Jenny looks down to the intersec below. She slips over the edge, regains her balance, turns and l back at the intersection below, and begins to get down fr the edge. Jenny grabs a hold of the ledge and carefully climbs down She sits down on a chair. Jenny rocks back and forth as s cries. She looks up at the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moon shines above in the sky. Forrest lies in a hammo on his boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought about Jenny all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest stands at the helm of his boat and slowly glides the docks. Forrest looks around and notices something and bends down to get a clear view. Lt. Dan sits in his wheel on the deck. Forrest looks at Lt. Dan. He smiles, surpris

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest leaps off of his moving boat and into the water. boat continues as Forrest clumsily swims. Lt. Dan sits in his wheelchair at the edge of the dock. Forrest flails hi arms as he swims up to the dock. Lt. Dan waits for Forres smoking a cigar. Forrest climbs up a ladder onto the dock

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant Dan, what are you doing  here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I thought I'd try out my sea  legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you ain't got no legs,  Lieutenant Dan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, well, Captain Forrest Gump. I  had to see this for myself. And I  told you if you were ever a shrimp  boat captain, that I'd be your first  mate. Well, here I am. I am a man of  my word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest shakes Lt. Dan's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but don't you be thinking that  I'm gonna be calling you sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest's boat glides, crushing a dock. Forrest and Lt. D look at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest's shrimping boat is alone on the gulf waters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a feeling if we head the east,  we'll find some shrimp. So, take a  left. Take a left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest looks up. Lt. Dan is sitting in the rigging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over there! They're over there! Get,  get on the wheel and take a left!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gump, what are you doing? Take a  left! Left! That's where we're gonna  find those shrimp, my boy! That's  where we'll find 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest empties the net. Their "catch" is debris that fal to the deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still no shrimp, Lieutenant Dan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, so I was wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, how we gonna find them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, maybe you should just pray for  shrimp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The all-black gospel choir sings and claps their hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I went to church every Sunday...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lt. Dan is sitting in his chair at the back of the church He takes swigs from a liquor bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes Lieutenant Dan came, too. Though I think he left the praying  up to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A catch of junk is dumped onto the deck. Lt. Dan lowers  himself from the rigging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shrimp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell's this God of yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wind begins to blow strong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's funny Lieutenant Dan said that,  'cause right then, God showed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water sprays on deck during a hurricane. Lt. Dan on the  rigging, shouts and shakes his fist as he is pelted by wi and rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll never sink this boat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now me, I was scared. But Lieutenant  Dan, he was mad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on! You call this a storm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest slides back and forth as he attempts to steer the boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blow, you son-of-a-bitch! Blow! It's  time for a showdown! You and me. I'm  right here. Come and get me! You'll  never sink this boat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ANCHORMAN over TV, is standing in front of a pier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over television) Hurricane Carmen came through here  yesterday...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The anchorman is standing in front of the ruined pier and boats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...destroying nearly everything in  its path. And as in other towns up  and down the coast, Bayou La Batre's  entire shrimping industry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...has fallen victim to Carmen and  has been left in utter ruin. Speaking  with local officials, this reporter  has learned, in fact, only one  shrimping boat actually survived the  storm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest's boat comes down the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise. Louise, there's Forrest!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After that, shrimpin' was easy.

dialogues.speaker: FORREST'S BOAT
dialogues.text: Lt. Dan and Forrest empty their net. A huge catch of shri falls onto the deck. Lt. Dan opens another big catch. Another catch drops open on top of yet another huge catch Forrest and Lt. Dan smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And since people still needed them  shrimps for shrimp cocktails and  barbecues and all...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man sitting on the bench listens to Forrest. An ELDER WOMAN sits next to the man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and we were the only boat left  standing "Bubba-Gump" shrimp's what  they got. We got a whole bunch of  boats. Twelve Jenny's, a big ol'  warehouse, we even have hats that says "Bubba-Gump" on 'em. "Bubba- Gump Shrimp." It's a household name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on there, boy. Are you telling me you're the owner of the Bubba- Gump Shrimp Corporation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. We've got more money than  Davy Crocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, I've heard some whoppers in my  time, but that tops them all. We was  sitting next to a millionaire!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man laughs as he walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I thought it was a very lovely  story. And you tell it so well. With  such enthusiasm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like to see what Lieutenant  Dan looks like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, yes, I would!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest shows her the cover of a "Fortune" magazine with  Forrest and Lt. Dan on the cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's him right there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elderly woman looks at the magazine and at Forrest wi surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And let me tell you something about  Lieutenant Dan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest and Lt. Dan are working on the boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest, I never thanked you for  saving my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest looks a little surprised. Lt. Dan smiles, then lo away. Lt. Dan pulls himself out of his chair to the raili and jumps into the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He never actually said so, but I  think he made his peace with God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest and Lt. Dan have dinner on the deck. The televisi shows an assassination attempt on President Gerald Ford.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over television) For the second time in seventeen  days, President Ford escaped possible  assassination today when a woman,  Sarah Jane Moore, fired on him as he  stepped out of a hotel in San  Francisco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over radio) Base to Jenny One. Base to Jenny  One.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny One, go Margo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over radio) Forrest has a phone call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well you'll have to tell them  to call him back. He is indisposed  at the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over radio) His momma's sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over television) Lynett Alice Fromme, a follower of  Charles Manson better known as  "Squeaky," attempted to assassinate  the President as he was...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest dives into the water as he reacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest carries a suitcase as he runs down the road. Forr runs past the row of mailboxes and turns into the drive. Louise and others are on the front porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Momma?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest opens the door, the doctor stands next to Mrs. Gu in bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Forrest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see you tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor looks down at Forrest's legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We sure got you straightened out,  didn't we, boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor leaves and closes the door. Forrest takes off hat and steps over to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter, Momma?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm dyin', Forrest. Come on in, sit  down over here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you dyin', Momma?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my time. It's just my time. Oh,  now, don't you be afraid, sweetheart. Death is just a part of life. It's  something we're all destined to do.  I didn't know it, but I was destined  to be your momma. I did the best I  could.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did good, Momma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I happened to believe you make  your own destiny. You have to do the  best with what God gave you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's my destiny, Momma?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna have to figure that out  for yourself. Life is a box of  chocolates, Forrest. You never know  what you're gonna get.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Momma always had a way of explaining  things so I could understand them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will miss you, Forrest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She had got the cancer and died on a  Tuesday. I bought her a new hat with  little flowers on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elderly woman and Forrest sit. The woman is crying an wipes her eyes with a hankie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's all I have to say about  that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bus stops. Forrest looks at the elderly woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't you say you were waiting for  the Number Seven bus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There'll be another one along shortly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, because I had been a football  star, and a war hero, and a national  celebrity, and a shrimpin' boat  captain, and a college graduate, the  city of fathers of Greenbow, Alabama,  decided to get together and offered  me a fine job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest rides a lawn tractor as he moves the football fie lawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I never went back to work for  Lieutenant Dan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest takes out a letter and opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Though he did take care of my Bubba- Gump money. He got me invested in  some kind of fruit company. And so  then I got a call from him saying we  don't have to worry about money no  more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I said, "That's good. One less  thing."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. CHURCH - DAY The choir and members are singing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, Momma said there's only so much  fortune a man really needs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sign reads: "Four Square Baptist Church." A new cross placed on the steeple. New furniture is taken inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Praise the Lord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and the rest is just for showing  off. So, I gave a whole bunch of it  to the Four Square Gospel Church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sign reads: "Gump Medical Center Bayou La Batre, Alab The ribbon-cutting ceremony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I gave a whole bunch to the Bayou  La Batre Fishing Hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A postman delivers a letter to Bubba's mom. She opens the letter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And even though Bubba was dead, and  Lieutenant Dan said I was nuts. I  gave Bubba's mommy Bubba's share.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is surrounded by her many children. She looks at the  check and faints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you know what...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A door opens as a white woman serves Bubba's mom some shr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't have to work in nobody's  kitchen no more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smells wonderful!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest rides the mower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And 'cause I was godzillionaire and  I liked doing it so much. I cut that  grass for free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest looks down the road as he steps onto the porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But at nighttime, when there was  nothing to do and the house was all  empty, I'd always think of Jenny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny's image walks, then vanishes. Forrest looks away. H turns and walks into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny walks across the lawn to Forrest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then, she was there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Forrest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Jenny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny came back and stayed with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny lies asleep in bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it was because she had nowhere  else to go. Or maybe it was because  she was so tired, because she went  to bed and slept and slept like she  hadn't slept in years. It was  wonderful having her home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest and Jenny walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every day we'd take a walk, and I'd  jabber on like a monkey in a tree. And she'd listen about ping-pong and  shrimpin' boats and Momma makin' a  trip to heaven. I did all the talkin'.  Jenny most of the time was real quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...big ol' gobs of rain and little  bitty stinging rain and rain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny's old house stands at the end of the dirt road. It  appears to be deserted. Jenny walks toward the house and  stops. She stares at the house. Forrest walks toward Jenn Jenny suddenly heaves a rock angrily at the house. She th other things at the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could you do this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She breaks a window. Jenny collapses to the ground and so Forrest knees down next to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes I guess there just aren't  enough rocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny and Forrest sit on a limb together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never really knew why she came  back, but I didn't care. It was like  olden times. We was like peas and  carrots again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny sits by the vase of flowers and look out the window

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every day I'd pick pretty flowers  and put them in her room for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest closes his eyes as he sits on the porch. Jenny pl a box of Nike running shoes in his lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she gave me the best gift anyone  could ever get in the wide world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, you can open your eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They make them just for running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the windows, Forrest and Jenny are dancing as it  rains outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she even showed me how to dance. And, well, we was like family...  Jenny and me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny and Forrest sit on a log together and look at the r Jenny places her arms around Forrest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it was the happiest time of my  life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fireworks explode in the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Statue of Liberty is shown on the TV. Fireworks go of Forrest and Jenny are watching the 4th of July celebratio on TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over television) And this Fourth is witnessing one of  the largest fireworks displays in  the nation's two-hundred year  history...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You done watching it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm-hmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over television) ...here in New York Harbor. After  the spectacular display of tall ships  earlier, the Statue of Liberty...

dialogues.text: But you won't marry me.

dialogues.text: Jenny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Where are you running off to?

He  looks at the medal he had give to Jenny. Jenny's bed is m Forrest stands in the doorway looking at the room and bed where Jenny had been.

dialogues.text: Forrest sit on a rocking chair with his running shoes on. is still, as if in a trance. He slowly puts on his Bubba- Gump cap. Forrest stands. He walks off the porch. He begi to jog across the lawn. His speed increases as he runs fa away. Forrest runs down the drive away from his house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That day, for no particular reason,  I decided to go for a little run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest runs to the end of the drive, then turns right an runs down the highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I ran to the end of the road, and  when I got there, I thought maybe  I'd run to the end of town.

dialogues.text: The three men sit as they watch the television. Forrest r through the main street of town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: President Carter, suffering from  heat exhaustion fell into the arms  of security agents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when I got there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I thought maybe I'd just run across  Greenbow County. And I figured since  I run this far, maybe I'd just run  across the great...

dialogues.text: Forrest runs by a sign that reads "Mississippi welcomes y The Magnolia State."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...state of Alabama. And that's what  I did I ran clear across Alabama.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For no particular reason, I just  kept on going. I ran clear to the  ocean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sign reads "Santa Monica yacht harbor sports fishing boating - cafes." Forrest runs under the sign and onto th pier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when I got there, I figured since  I'd gone this far, I might as well  turn around, just keep on going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest runs to a pier at the Atlantic Ocean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I got to another ocean, I figured  since I've gone this far, I might as  well just turn back, keep right on  going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest runs across the pier. A lighthouse stands at the of the pier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I got tired, I slept. When I  got hungry, I ate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I had to go, you know, I went.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so, you just ran?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest is running along the highway. Forrest runs down a road between field of wheat. A Mountain river. Forrest ru across a cobble-stone bridge. The Rocky Mountains are beh him in distance. Forrest runs through some meadowland. Split rail fences line the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd think a lot about Momma and Bubba,  and Lieutenant Dan, but most of all,  I thought about Jenny. I thought  about her a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three men in the barber shop watch the news on televi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For more than two years now, a man  named Forrest Gump, a gardener from  Greenbow, Alabama, stopping only to  sleep, has been running across  America.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny fills customer's coffee cups.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles Cooper brings us this report.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the fourth time on his journey  across America, Forrest Gump, a  gardener from Greenbow, Alabama, is  about to cross the Mississippi River  again today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TV shows Forrest runs across a bridge that reads  "Mississippi River."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be damned. Forrest...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, why are you running?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you running?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you doing this for world peace?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you doing this for women's right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or for the environment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or for animals?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or for nuclear arms?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They just couldn't believe that  somebody would do all that running  for no particular reason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you doing this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just felt like running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just left like running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest runs as a YOUNG MAN runs up to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's you. I can't believe it's really  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, for some reason what I was doing  seemed to make sense to people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The young man jobs behind Forrest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, it was like an alarm went  off in my head, you know. I said,  here's a guy that's got his act  together. Here's somebody who's got  it, all figured out. Here's somebody  who has the answer. I'll follow you  anywhere, Mr. Gump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I got company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest runs up a slope on a high mountain road. A group people are jogging behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And after that I got more company. And then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large group jogs behind Forrest across the desert road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...even more people joined in. Somebody later told me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...it gave people hope. Now... Now,  I don't know anything about that,  but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest and his followers job through a small town. A man runs up and talks to Forrest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of those people asked me if I  could help them out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, man, hey, listen. I was wondering  if you might help me, huh? Listen,  I'm in the bumper sticker business  and I've been trying to think up a  good slogan. And since you have been  such a big inspiration to the people  around here, I thought you might be  able to help me jump into... Whoa! Man, you just ran through a big pile  of dogshit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hippie jumps over the "dogshit" as he runs along Forr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, shit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hippie stops to ponder this profound thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And some years later I heard that  fella did come up with a bumper  sticker slogan...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bumper sticker reads "Shit Happens."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and he make a lot of money off of  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck with the bumper sticker drives into an intersec It collides with a car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest runs, followed by his group, as a man runs up to  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another time I was running along,  somebody who had lost all his money  in the T-shirt business, and he wanted  to put my face on a T-shirt, but he  couldn't draw that well and he didn't  have a camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it would be really fortunate  for me if I could get your name on  these, oh, your face and name on  these T-shirts. It would be wonderful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A truck splashes mud onto Forrest as it goes by. The man  hands Forrest a yellow T-shirt to use as a rag to wipe th mud off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, use this one. Nobody likes  that color anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest wipes his face on the towel and hands it back to man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a nice day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man looks at the T-shirt. He holds it up displaying t "Happy Face."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And some years later I found out  that that man did come up with a  idea for a T-shirt and he made a lot  of money off of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest runs with a group that follows behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, like I was saying, I had a  lot of company. My Momma always said  you got to put the past behind you  before you can move on. And I think  that's what my running was all about. I had run for three years, two months,  fourteen days, and sixteen hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest stops running. The group stops behind him. Forres stands and looks as the group waits expectantly. Forrest  turns and look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet. Quiet, he's gonna say  something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm pretty tired. I think I'll go  home now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest walks toward the group. The group parts for Forre as he walks down the middle of the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what are we supposed to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And just like that, my running days  was over. So, I went home to Alabama.

dialogues.text: A television shows President Reagan and his staff as they react to gunshots in front of a limo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over television) Moments ago, at two twenty-five p.m.,  as President Reagan was leaving the  Washington Hilton Hotel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...five or six gunshots were fired  by an unknown would-be assassin. The  President was shot in the chest and  the assailant was immediately tackled  by a half a dozen lawmen. As the  Presidential...

dialogues.text: I picked up the mail.

dialogues.text: Oh, thank you, Miss, Miss Louise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...wondering if I could come down to  Savannah to see her, and that's what  I'm doing here. She saw me on TV,  running, I'm supposed to go on the  Number Nine bus to Richmond Street  and get off and go one block left to  1-9-4-7 Henry Street, Apartment 4.

dialogues.text: Down that way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down that way.

dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.text: Come in. Come in.

dialogues.text: I got your letter.

dialogues.text: Oh, I was wondering about that.

dialogues.text: Is this your house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's messy right now. I just  got off work.

dialogues.text: It's nice. You got air conditioning.

dialogues.text: Ah...

dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I kept, I kept a scrapbook of  your, of your clippings and  everything. There you are. This, I  got your running.

dialogues.text: I ran a long way. For a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There. Listen, Forrest. I don't know  how to say this. Um, I just... I  want to apologize for anything that  I ever did to you, 'cause I was messed  up for a long time, and...

dialogues.text: Would you marry me, Forrest?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you, Forrest, take Jenny to be  your wife? Do you, Jenny, take Forrest  to be your husband? If so, I pronounce  you man and wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.text: Forrest sets the tray down next to Jenny as she sits up i bed. Forrest opens a window, then sits down next to the b

dialogues.text: Yes. Well, I, I don't know.

dialogues.text: Forrest looks up into the sky as the rain stops. Forrest  removes his helmet. The stars emerge from behind the clou

dialogues.text: Sometimes it would stop raining long  enough for the stars to come out.  And then it was nice. It was like  just before the sun goes to bed down  on the bayou...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was over a million sparkles on  the water. Like that mountain lake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was so clear, Jenny. It looks  like there were two skies, one on  top of the other. And then in the  desert, when the sun comes up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest runs along a desert highway. The morning light ca an orange glow over the desert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't tell where heavens stopped  and the earth began. It was so  beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest looks at Jenny. Jenny looks out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I could have been there with  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny reaches over and takes Forrest's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You died on a Saturday morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I had you placed here under our  tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny's grave marker. Forrest tries to hold back his tear

dialogues.text: And I had that house of your father's  bulldozed to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Momma...

dialogues.text: ...always said dyin' was a part of  life.

dialogues.text: Jenny's grave marker reads: JENNY GUMP July 16, 1945 -- M 22, 1982 Beloved Mother, Wife and Friend

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sure wish it wasn't. Little Forrest,  he's doing just fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading) "But he wasn't quite sure. Everywhere  they went, the new guests...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About to start school again soon. I  make his breakfast, lunch, and  dinner...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...every day. I make sure he combs  his hair and brushes his teeth every  day. Teaching him how to play ping  pong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's really good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest, you go.

dialogues.text: Forrest Jr. serves the ball, causing Forrest dive and mis it.

dialogues.text: Forrest and Forrest Jr. sit on a log by the river and fis

dialogues.text: We fish a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest looks down at the grave marker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And every night, we read a book. He's so smart, Jenny. You'd be so  proud of him. I am. He, uh, wrote a  letter, and he says I can't read it.  I'm not supposed to, so I'll just  leave it here for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest places the letter down at the grave marker, next fresh flowers. The name on the envelope reads: "Mom." For steps back and looks down at the grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny, I don't know if Momma was  right or if, if it's Lieutenant Dan. I don't know if we each have a  destiny, or if we're all just floating  around accidental-like on a breeze,  but I, I think maybe it's both. Maybe  both is happening at the same time.  I miss you, Jenny. If there's anything  you need, I won't be far away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Forrest walks away, a flock of birds flies overhead an lands in the tree. Forrest turns and watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest walks with Forrest Jr. for the bus. The bus drive toward them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's your bus. Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest pulls "Curious George" out of Forrest Jr.'s backp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I know this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna show that for show-and- tell because grandma used to read it  to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest looks at the book. The feather from the beginning the movie drops out of the book, unnoticed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My favorite book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus comes to a stop. The door opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest puts the book back into Forrest Jr.'s backpack an hands it to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...okay. Hey, there you go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest Jr. walks toward the bus. Forrest stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Forrest. Don't... I wanted to  tell you I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you too, Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be right here when you get back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest Jr. looks into the bus and at the bus driver. It the same bus driver, only older now, who drove Forrest to school when he was a young boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You understand this is the bus to  school now, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, and you're Dorothy Harris  and I'm Forrest Gump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest Jr. looks over and waves to his father. Forrest n approvingly. Forrest Jr. gets on the bus. The bus pulls away. Forrest  stands next to the mailbox. Forrest sits down. The camera cranes down, revealing the  feather as it lies at Forrest's feet. A gust of wind picks the feather up. The feather floats u into the air. Forrest sits at the side of the road. The feather floats  higher into the air. The feather soars up into the sky and travels up and down then covers the camera lens.
